Re: Linux Kernel
We're running with 2.4.21-32.0.1.ELsmp. I do not believe t=
hat there should
by any trouble using the version you have right now.
 
Re:=
Heritrix parallel processing
Heritrix can not run in a parallel environment=
 in a cooperative manner.
Typically, multiple machines crawls are done by s=
egmenting the crawl scope.
I.e. divide the websites to crawl amongst the cr=
awl machines.
There are plans to make coordinated multimachine crawling a p=
osibility, but
this does not exist yet.
 
- Kris

-----Original Message----=
-

[mailto:archive-crawler@yahoogroups=

Subject: [archive-crawler] Re: can Anybody tell me=

HERITRIX....... ???


Hi Kris,

Can you please let me kn=
ow which version of RedHat Linux's Kernel is 
running on your machine. I ha=
ve installed Kernel 2.4.21-4.ELsmp on 
my machine. Would it be communicatin=
g with Heritrix crawler or not?

Please help me out from this problem.

Wit=
h regards,
Shadab


--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "Kristinn Sigur=
dsson" 
<kris@a...> wrote:
>
> 1. Not as such, although there was an issue =
with Heritrix builds 
failing on
> 2.6 kernels at some point. Myself, I'm r=
unning on Red Hat, but 
that is
> simply because thats what we use here, no=
t because Heritrix runs 
better on
> it. (Michael, I think there should be =
a FAQ entry for this 
question). Just
> make sure you've got Java 1.4.2 or =
better installed and you should 
be fine. 
>  
> 2. Depends on the hardware=
. Assuming that there are enough active 
queues
> (meaning the KB/sec is no=
t limited by politness rules) the crawler 
is
> capable of (in my experianc=
e) going as high 21.1 Mbits/sec (over a 
period of
> 24 hours). Peak loads =
can be higher, especially if you are 
downloading a lot
> of larger files. =
If many crawling text documents, bandwidth usage 
drops,
> since each text =
document is subjected to link extraction that 
takes time.
> The throughput=
 in terms of documents per second for the 24 hour 
period cited
> above was=
 approx. 57 docs/sec. (about 5 million docs and 214GB of
> uncompressed dat=
a in 24 hours).
>  
> The hardware in question includes dual Xeon processor=
s and 2 gigs 
worth of
> memory (+ abundant disk storage). Heritrix likes p=
rocessor power 
in my
> experience, its performance is usually limited by t=
his factor 
although
> additional memory can somewhat improve throughput fo=
r high end 
machines.
>  
> 3. Yep, read the User Manual. It has a section =
on installation 
and "A quick
> guide to running your first crawl job" whic=
h should get you up and 
running
> in no time. 
http://crawler.archive.org/=
articles/user_manual.html#tutorial
>  
> - Kris
>
